result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A. Rud

records.addlTxt: 10:01 AM Defendant Robert A. Rud in court.  Attorney Jay E. Heit in court for Robert A. Rud.  Attorney Loralee Clark in court for State of Wisconsin. This is the date and time set for a Motion Hearing on the Defendant's Motion to Compel. Defense is now in receipt of the Defendant's certified driving record amd will need time to review with his client. The motion hearing scheduled for today is no longer needed.
Motion hearing on October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:48 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Robert A. Rud in court with Attorney Jay E. Heit. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court accepts the plea.

Branch 1 for further scheduling.
Dated 08/16/2022, Letter from Attorney Jay Heit providing defendant's updated address.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert A. Rud
Current: 2046 Schut Street, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States  (Effective: 08-16-2022)
Prior: 2303 4th St, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States

(3:53 PM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Robert A. Rud in court. Attorney Kevin G. Dague appears on behalf of Attorney Jay E. Heit in court for Robert A. Rud.
Parties are ready to proceed.
State calls Officer Anthony Briski of the Eau Claire Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Dague conducts cross-examination of Officer Briski. Witness excused.
State moves for bind over. Attorney Dague has no argument.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
Attorney Heit to schedule an Arraignment with Branch 1 Judicial Assistant.
